sentences: Suured lapsed on alati heasid m√§ngijad.
context: The word 'suurem' is the comparative form of the adjective 'suur' meaning 'big'. It is used to compare two things, indicating that one is bigger/larger/greater than another. In Estonian adjectives have three degrees: positive (suur - big), comparative (suurem - bigger), and superlative (suurim - biggest).
